<@U2SE05657>  - seems like your chaincode was never deployed
<@U2SE05657>  I had this experience when you immediately try to query the chain code after deploying because chaincode is still being deployed on server side
if we wait few seconds and there is no error on peer logs, it should work. Try increasing the delay from 2 seconds to 5 or 10 seconds in PeerClientTest

<@U2SE05657> are you able to deploy and query chain code using Node SDK? It looks like this issue has been addressed in fabric <https://github.com/hyperledger-archives/fabric/issues/1582>
But since you are using a published image, you might not have that fix. Or may be it is a similar problem that you just uncovered

attachments.title: chaincode networkmode cannot be changed · Issue #1582 · hyperledger-archives/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: Description Container supports various network mode, and may even change in future. Currently, the chaincode only supported a fixed networkmode of "host" in the code, while this will prevent usi...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: chaincode networkmode cannot be changed · Issue #1582 · hyperledger-archives/fabric

text: I did not tried Node SDK. Thank you for your answer <@U1Y2R5C9L>
<@U2SE05657>  <@U1Y2R5C9L>   - sorry - got pulled away
do <@U2SE05657> - thanks for posting the screenshot - looks like you are running on Ubuntu?
basically the peer container cannot connect to the Docker endpoint  `CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=unix:///var/run/docker.sock`
yep
you'll need to actually mount the socket as a volume -

```
membersrvc:
  image: hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc
  ports:
    - "7054:7054"
  command: membersrvc
vp0:
  image: hyperledger/fabric-peer
  ports:
    - "7050:7050"
    - "7051:7051"
    - "7052:7052"
  volumes:
    - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
  environment:
    - CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true
    - CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=unix:///var/run/docker.sock
    - CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=DEBUG
    - CORE_PEER_ID=vp0
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLID=test_vp0
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLSECRET=MwYpmSRjupbT
  links:
    - membersrvc
  command: sh -c "sleep 5; peer node start"
```

``` ERRO 09a sending init failed(handler not found for chaincode mycc)```  
This is referencing the same application that the nodejs sample is deploying.
also what does it mean ?  ```Deploy -> DEBU 097 user runs chaincode, not deploying chaincode``` ?
It looks that you are running chain code in dev mode, in that case you yourself need to execute the chaincide binary before running the deploy transaction
Follow the steps <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Chaincode-setup/#starting-and-registering-the-chaincode>
